step_1.description: The paper describes the disease mechanism involving R-synuclein (RS) forming fibrils in Lewy bodies and the SL1 binding mode contributing to toxicity.

step_2.description: Solution NMR is used to study phospholipid binding, directly relevant to the disease mechanism of RS aggregation.

step_3a.description: The study compares variants to wild-type RS as a normal control but does not explicitly mention additional pathogenic or benign controls.

step_3b.description: NMR is a well-established technique in the field, and the study references prior work to validate findings.

step_4a.description: No explicit statistical analysis (e.g., p-values, OddsPath) is provided for individual variants.

step_4b.description: Only wild-type RS is used as a control, resulting in fewer than 10 total controls.
